intro: Leucoploeus, commonly known as the silverleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of silver-gray, fuzzy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid conditions. Its flowers are yellow and produce small, wind-dispersed seeds. Leucoploeus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in dry, sunny environments.
